page.title: 04Farming - Crops
page.content: This is an agricultural area covered with intensive grassland which is made into silage and hay. Cereals such as corn and oats are the second heaviest crop and like the grassland provide winter feed for the animals. Catch crops such as kale, swedes and turnips are also grown for animal feeds. Apples are grown for cider making. These apples are too unpleasant to eat, being rather bitter. They are harvested by spreading large nets underneath the trees and literally shaken down; bruising of the fruit is unimportant as they are going to be crushed anyhow. Coxland Farm have their own press and they are well known in the area for the quality of their cider. There is also a large apple orchard at Horselake with Cox's Orange Pippins and Bramleys. By Mrs N Butterworth
